form.label: Where is my Bucket?

input.label: Host
input.populatingSearch: | inputlookup fb_hostname_index_cache | dedup orig_host | sort orig_host

input.label: Index
input.populatingSearch: | inputlookup fb_hostname_index_cache | search orig_host=$host$ | dedup orig_index | sort orig_index

html.div:
This view shows the history of a specific index bucket. The bucket ID is a required input.
The chart displays information about the size of the bucket, and is color coded to represent the state of the bucket. This representation is drawn from the dbinspect data. The first data collection from that source may have caught the bucket "in flight" rather than showing the nascent bucket, so the "hot" or "warm" states might not be represented.
The panels titled Bucket State Transitions and Bucket Transition Events display log events from the splunkd.log about the bucket. Note that the default retention period for the _internal index (where these events are stored) is only 30 days, so these panels may be empty for old buckets.

chart.title: Bucket State and Size Over Time
chart.searchString: `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$, $bucket_id$)` | extract auto=f fb_extract_bucket_type_time_source | extract auto=f fb_extract_hot_bucket | search bucket_type!="rb" | bucket _time span=1d | stats max(eval(if(state="hot", sizeOnDiskMB, 0))) AS hot, max(eval(if(state="warm", sizeOnDiskMB, 0))) AS warm, max(eval(if(state="cold", sizeOnDiskMB, 0))) AS cold, max(eval(if(state="thawed", sizeOnDiskMB, 0))) AS thawed, by _time

form.searchTemplate: `fb_bucket_transitions($host$, *)` | fields + timestamped, bucket_parent, bucket, bucket_id, idx, from, isinit, tag::eventtype, now, latest, frozenTimePeriodInSecs | `_fb_figure_idx_name_from_home_or_cold_path` | search idx=$index$ bucket_id=$bucket_id$ | `fb_bucket_transition_pp` | sort _time
